headline: Meta (META)’s AI Glasses Could Hit Tipping Point by 2026, Says Citi
summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) is one of the AI Stocks Analysts Are Tracking Closely. On September 18, Citi reiterated the stock as “Buy” Citi stating that it’s bullish on the company’s AI smart glass following a presentation at Meta’s Connect conference. “With three new AI smart glasses launched at Connect, we emerge incrementally positive on Meta’s […]

headline: Trump Announces $100K Fee for H-1B Visas. How Big Tech Companies Could Be Affected.
summary: The Trump administration on Friday issued a proclamation adding a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas, a special type of employment visa for highly skilled workers.  Big Tech companies are major users of these types of visas.  Six companies–  Alphabet Amazon.com Apple Meta Platforms Microsoft  and  Nvidia  –used 35,000 of the 85,000 available H-1B visas in the 2025 fiscal year.

headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Garmin (GRMN) Expanding Wearables and AI Partnerships with Meta and Academia
summary: In recent days, Garmin unveiled multiple new devices, including the Venu 4 smartwatch, Bounce 2 for kids, the Instinct Crossover AMOLED, and new cycling computers, while also announcing collaborations with Meta for AI-powered training insights and with King's College London for a maternal health research initiative powered by Garmin wearables. The combination of product launches and cross-industry partnerships highlights Garmin's emphasis on integrating advanced health, safety, and fitness...

headline: Bernstein likens TikTok’s U.S. deal to ’New Coke’ gamble
summary: Investing.com --Bernstein likened the proposed U.S. deal for TikTok to Coca-Cola’s ill-fated New Coke launch, warning that the app’s rebranded version could struggle to retain its 170 million American users if the migration falters.
